results.title: 1. The horticultural sector’s relative contribution to the regional economy in NW Rwanda will have increased significantly
2. Improved food and nutrition security of poor households
1. Increased sustainable production and supplies of horticultural produce from smallholders (M/F)
2. Increased accessibility and intake of appropriate foods
3. Increased horticulture exports from the project districts
4. An increased enabling environment for horticulture development
1.1. Trained RAB extension staff, FFS Facilitators and Farmer Promoters are able to implement improved horticultural production techniques
1.2. Strengthened performance of horticultural cooperatives and farmer groups in the six target districts
1.3. Horticulture SMEs are able to provide improved services related to input supplies, production and/or marketing
1.4. Smallholder farmers in the six project districts know how to implement smart cultivation practices
1.5. Rwandan horticulture businesses have the opportunity to network
2.1 Food & Nutrition Security

2.2. local health and agricultural workers and staff of partner organisations are able to train others on the importance of fruit and vegetable production and consumption, as part of a diverse, healthy diet
2.3. Consumers are aware of the importance of fruit and vegetable consumption
3.1. Awareness and increase in export development
3.2. Buyers in high-value markets are aware of the “Rwanda Fresh” promotional campaign
3.3. Rwandan horticulture companies and producers are able to qualify for certification in line with export market requirements
3.4. Increased horticulture export businesses with linkages to out-grower schemes
3.5. Access to finance by companies through IIF
3.6. New varieties of Fruits & Vegetables produced by Rwandan exporters
4.1. National and regional capacities for supportive and enabling horticultural sector development policies are strengthened
4.2. Urgent and important horticulture sector issues are addressed and resolved through public-private collaboration
4.3. Performance and capacities of public and private horticultural support services are strengthened and upgraded
4.4. Increased level of involvement of youth and women in the horticulture sector
